verses.kjv: My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, not many of you should become teachers, because you know that those of us who teach will be judged more strictly.

verses.kjv: For in many things we offend all. If any man offend not in word, the same is a perfect man, and able also to bridle the whole body.
verses.ct: We all stumble in many ways. If someone never makes a mistake in what they say, that person has reached maturity and can also keep their entire body in check.

verses.kjv: Behold, we put bits in the horses’ mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.
verses.ct: Think about this: we place bits in horses' mouths so they will obey us, and with that small piece we direct their whole body.

verses.kjv: Behold also the ships, which though they be so great, and are driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.
verses.ct: Consider also ships — even though they are massive and pushed by powerful winds, they are steered by a tiny rudder wherever the pilot wants to go.

verses.kjv: Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things. Behold, how great a matter a little fire kindleth!
verses.ct: In the same way, the tongue is a small part of the body, yet it makes enormous claims. Think about how a tiny spark can set an entire forest ablaze!

verses.kjv: And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.
verses.ct: The tongue is like a fire — a whole world of evil among the parts of our body. It corrupts the entire person, sets the whole course of life on fire, and is itself ignited by hell.

verses.kjv: For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:
verses.ct: Every kind of animal, bird, reptile, and sea creature has been tamed and continues to be tamed by human beings.

verses.kjv: But the tongue can no man tame; it is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.
verses.ct: But no one can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, filled with deadly poison.

verses.kjv: Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.
verses.ct: With it we praise God our Father, and with it we curse people who are made in God's likeness.

verses.kjv: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.
verses.ct: Praise and cursing pour out of the same mouth. Brothers and sisters, this should never happen.

verses.kjv: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and bitter?
verses.ct: Does a spring produce both fresh water and bitter water from the same opening?

verses.kjv: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, can a fig tree produce olives? Can a grapevine produce figs? Of course not — and a saltwater spring cannot produce fresh water either.

verses.kjv: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.
verses.ct: Is anyone among you wise and understanding? Then let them demonstrate it through a good life, with actions done in the humility that comes from wisdom.

verses.kjv: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.
verses.ct: But if you harbor bitter jealousy and selfish ambition in your hearts, don't brag about it and don't deny the truth.

verses.kjv: This wisdom descendeth not from above, but is earthly, sensual, devilish.
verses.ct: That kind of so-called wisdom doesn't come down from heaven. Instead, it is worldly, driven by selfish desires, and demonic.

verses.kjv: For where envying and strife is, there is confusion and every evil work.
verses.ct: Wherever jealousy and selfish ambition exist, you will also find disorder and every kind of evil practice.

verses.kjv: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.
verses.ct: But the wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure, then peace-loving, considerate, open to reason, overflowing with mercy and good results, impartial, and sincere.

verses.kjv: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.
verses.ct: Those who work for peace plant seeds of righteousness and harvest a crop of peace.
